item.title: 中国连续第二个月维持政策性贷款利率不变
item.description: 中国央行在上一次于 9 月份下调政策性贷款利率后保持利率不变，因为当局在加大货币刺激力度方面保持了耐心。【原文：China’s central bank kept a policy loan rate unchanged after last cutting it in September, as the authorities stay patient in ramping up monetary stimulus.】

item.title: 日本铁路股票因京成电机积极入股消息而飙升
item.description: 周一上午，日本火车运营商京成电气铁道株式会社（Keisei Electric Railway Co.【原文：Shares in Japanese train operators Keisei Electric Railway Co. and Keikyu Corp. jumped Monday morning following reports that a fund linked to activist investor Yoshiaki Murakami has built stakes in both companies.】

item.title: 乌克兰战争升级导致黄金上周大涨后保持稳定
item.description: 由于俄乌战争升级提振了避险需求，黄金在上周创下 20 个月来最大涨幅后趋于稳定。【原文：Gold steadied after jumping the most in 20 months last week as an escalation in the Russia-Ukraine war boosted haven demand.】

item.title: 印尼证券交易所考虑提高首次公开募股的上市标准
item.description: 印尼证券交易所正在考虑要求首次公开发行股票的最低募集资金，作为改革上市规则工作的一部分。【原文：The Indonesia Stock Exchange is considering requiring minimum proceeds for initial public offerings as part of efforts to revamp listing rules.】

item.title: 下一波音乐产业整合浪潮即将到来
item.description:
音乐产业正在进入一个新时代，这一新时代的驱动因素包括大型唱片公司的增长放缓、独立音乐公司市场的不断扩大以及私募股权投资的迅猛发展。【原文：

The music industry is entering new era, one driven by a slowdown at the major labels, the growing market for independents and the rapacity of private equity.  

】

item.title: 外籍人士减少、中国人涌入重塑香港租赁市场
item.description: 由于人口结构的变化，香港的租赁市场正处于两极对立的状态。【原文：Hong Kong’s rental market is at polar opposites due to a shift in demographics.】

item.title: 美元的年末强势将让位于不明朗的 2025 年
item.description: 根据彭博市场实时脉搏的最新调查，美元将在 2025 年初站稳脚跟，然后在未来一年面临通胀加快和财政赤字激增等风险。【原文：The dollar is set to start 2025 on solid footing before facing risks such as faster inflation and a surging fiscal deficit over the coming year, according to the latest Bloomberg Markets Live Pulse survey.】

item.title: 菲律宾顶级公司关注掉期市场以管理债务风险
item.description: 菲律宾的顶级企业正在寻求利用新的比索利率互换机制来管理其债务支付，此举可能会推动菲律宾深化其资本市场。【原文：Top Philippine firms are looking to manage their debt payments by using the new peso interest-rate swap facility, a move that may bolster the nation’s push to deepen its capital market.】

item.title: 新西兰零售支出再次放缓，指向经济衰退
item.description: 由于高利率挫伤了消费者的情绪，新西兰零售支出连续第二个季度下降，这使得年中经济陷入衰退的迹象更加明显。【原文：New Zealand retail spending fell for a second straight quarter as high interest rates dented consumer sentiment, adding to signs the economy was in recession in the middle of the year.】

item.title: 美元下跌，财政部人选打消特朗普的赌注：市场综述
item.description: 美元下跌，比特币涨势停滞，因为交易商认为唐纳德-特朗普挑选斯科特-贝森特担任财政部长是一个有分寸的选择，缓和了当选总统获胜所引发的一些更狂热的押注。【原文：The dollar fell and Bitcoin’s rally stalled as traders viewed Donald Trump’s pick of Scott Bessent for Treasury Secretary as a measured choice, tempering some of the more fevered bets spurred by the president-elect’s victory.】

item.title: 比特币在接近 100,000 美元历史高位后涨势停滞
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普对加密货币的支持引发了投资者的乐观情绪，在比特币反弹至100,000美元的历史高位后，比特币出现了回落。【原文：Bitcoin retreated after a rally toward $100,000 sputtered just shy of the historic level amid warnings that investor optimism stemming from President-elect Donald Trump’s support for crypto was getting overdone.】

item.title: 亚马逊的 "登月计划 "将在人工智能芯片领域与英伟达一较高下
item.description:
这家云计算巨头不会在短期内赶走现有供应商，但希望减少对芯片制造商的依赖。【原文：

The cloud computing giant won’t dislodge the incumbent anytime soon but is hoping to reduce its reliance on the chipmaker.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 咖啡中的优质阿拉比卡咖啡豆价格飙升，这将影响您早晨摄入咖啡因的价格。白银供不应求。欧洲在减少库存以度过寒冬后，将面临更昂贵的天然气。【原文：Coffee’s premium arabica bean is soaring in a move that’s set to impact the price of your morning caffeine fix. Silver demand is outstripping supply. And Europe will face more expensive natural gas after drawing down stockpiles to weather winter.】

item.title: 今年中国出口将在特朗普第二任期前创下新高
item.description: 鉴于美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普在 1 月份上台后威胁要征收更高的关税，客户急于提前下订单，经济学家预计今年中国的出口将达到历史最高水平。【原文：Economists expect Chinese exports to reach a historical high this year as customers rush to front-load orders given President-elect Donald Trump’s threat of higher tariffs when he takes office in January.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮让拥有 139 年历史的电缆制造商成为日本最热门股票
item.description: 全球人工智能的蓬勃发展，让一家有着 139 年历史的不起眼的日本公司成为股市明星。【原文：The global boom in AI has turned an obscure 139-year-old Japanese company into a stock-market star.】

item.title: 路透社称印度拒绝苹果暂停反垄断报告的请求
item.description: 据路透社周日报道，印度反垄断机构拒绝了苹果公司提出的搁置一份发现其违反印度竞争法的报告的请求，路透社援引了该新闻机构看到的监管机构的一份内部命令。【原文：Apple Inc.’s request to put on hold a report that found it breached competition laws in India was rejected by the country’s antitrust body, Reuters reported Sunday, citing an internal order from the regulator seen by the news outlet.】

item.title: 贝森特被提名财政部长，美元涨势降温
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普提名斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）监管美国财政部，这使美元近期的涨势受到一定影响。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s nomination of Scott Bessent to oversee the US Treasury is taking some heat out of the dollar’s recent rally.】

item.title: 阿达尼的指控考验特朗普将印度留在美国轨道上的愿望
item.description: 2018年，中国科技巨头华为技术有限公司的一名高管因违反美国法律被捕，震惊了习近平主席的核心圈子，并引发了唐纳德-特朗普是否会干预此案的疑问。【原文：In 2018, the arrest of an executive with Chinese tech giant Huawei Technologies Co. for breaching US laws shocked President Xi Jinping’s inner circle and raised questions over whether Donald Trump would intervene in the case.】

item.title: 中国投资者再次消化大型科技公司财报带来的失望
item.description: 从腾讯控股有限公司（Tencent Holdings Ltd.）到阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.），中国的科技领军企业在这个受经济和地缘政治不确定性困扰的季度交出了令人失望的成绩单。它们能否重新赢得投资者的青睐，可能越来越取决于中国政府的行动。【原文：From Tencent Holdings Ltd. to Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., China’s tech leaders delivered underwhelming numbers for a quarter beset by economic and geopolitical uncertainty. Whether or not they can win back investors may increasingly hinge on Beijing’s actions.】

item.title: 新西兰央行下调利率的赌注令新西兰元逼近2022年低点
item.description: 预计未来几个月新西兰元将贬值约 6%，因为经济放缓促使投资者对该国央行积极降息的预期进行定价。【原文：The New Zealand dollar is forecast to weaken around 6% in the coming months as a slowing economy prompts investors to price in aggressive interest rate cuts from the nation’s central bank.】

item.title: 债券市场停止暴跌，买家抢购 4.5% 收益率的债券
item.description: 美国债券市场在经历了两个月的大跌后终于出现了企稳迹象，每当收益率测试新高时，投资者就开始大举进场。【原文：The US bond market is finally showing signs of steadying after a two-month selloff, with investors starting to swoop in whenever yields test new peaks.】

item.title: 智利央行行长称特朗普将加剧贸易紧张局势
item.description: 智利中央银行行长罗珊娜-科斯塔（Rosanna Costa）在接受采访时说，她预计贸易紧张局势将随着唐纳德-特朗普重返美国总统宝座而加剧。【原文：Chilean Central Bank Governor Rosanna Costa said she expects trade tensions to increase with Donald Trump’s return as US president, La Tercera reported, citing an interview.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜迫使华尔街一度声势浩大的一角重整旗鼓
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫，迫使华尔街一个术语较多的角落重新思考其谈话要点。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is forcing one of Wall Street’s more jargon-filled corners to rethink its talking points.】

item.title: 阿尔及利亚罕见首次公开募股后，2025 年至少还将有三家公司上市
item.description: 阿尔及利亚今年 3 月进行了八年来的首次公开募股，预计 2025 年至少还将有三次公开募股，因为该国希望发展规模小、流动性差的证券交易所，并实现经济多样化。【原文：Algeria, which in March saw its first public initial offering in eight years, expects at least three others in 2025 as it looks to grow its small and illiquid stock exchange and diversify the economy.】

item.title: 美国机构对阿达尼斯里兰卡项目进行尽职调查
item.description: 一家同意向斯里兰卡阿达尼集团支持的港口开发项目贷款 5 亿多美元的美国机构表示，在该企业集团的亿万富翁创始人和其他高管被指控行贿之后，该机构仍在对该项目进行尽职调查。【原文：A US agency that agreed to lend more than $500 million to an Adani Group-backed port development in Sri Lanka said it’s still conducting due diligence on the project, following bribery allegations against the conglomerate’s billionaire founder and other top executives.】

item.title: 苹果在电视领域的下一步应该是流媒体手柄而非全套设备
item.description: 苹果不需要自己的电视机。但它应该生产一种低成本的电视流媒体棒，将其内容、应用程序和智能家居功能带给更多家庭。还有Siri 将在现代人工智能时代改头换面；亚马逊击败苹果，推出新款智能家居显示器；Oura 和 Dexcom 合作，力图将血糖跟踪技术推向主流。【原文：Apple doesn’t need its own TV set. But it should make a low-cost TV streaming stick to bring its content, apps and smart home features to more households. Also: Siri will be revamped for the modern AI era; Amazon beats Apple to new smart home displays; and Oura and Dexcom team up in a bid to make glucose tracking mainstream.】

item.title: 新兴市场应对 "特朗普经济学"，垃圾债券面临风险
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普说到做到，新兴市场的垃圾债券反弹有可能只是过去四年债务危机和未来四年新一轮困境之间的一个插曲。【原文：The junk-bond rally in emerging markets risks being just an interlude between the debt crisis of the past four years and a new bout of distress in the next four, if Donald Trump does what he says he will.】

item.title: 伊朗计划本周与欧洲国家举行核会谈
item.description: 据共同社周日援引未透露身份的伊朗外交消息人士的话报道，伊朗计划本周与英国、法国和德国就其核计划举行会谈。【原文：Iran plans to hold talks about its nuclear program with the UK, France and Germany this week, Kyodo reported on Sunday, citing Iranian diplomatic sources who weren’t identified.】
